timeline.message:
Update based on suggestions

Signed-off-by: liach <liach@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.author: Earthcomputer

replies.bodyText: Uh, isn't mixin javadoc saying Use in conjunction with {@link Final}?
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText:
Humm, I have never used it with @Final, but yeah you should go with what the docs say.
Rip now I have a bunch of unspecified behaviour to fix :D
replies.author: Earthcomputer

timeline.bodyText: I assume this will be bumped to 1.0.0 during the pre releases
timeline.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: You see the added class is @Deprecated, so why 1.0.0 if this api is subject to change
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: You didn't read the whole message lol. I said this should be bumped when we reach prereleases where this will be mostly concrete.
replies.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: I still want to use 1.0.0 everywhere, experimental doesn't quite mean the same as wip
replies.author: sfPlayer1

timeline.bodyText: It's 2020 @sfPlayer1 @modmuss50 we need to bump the license year.
timeline.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: Not my fault, and this pr won't go out of scope.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Yes it isn't really your issue, but player and modmuss need to bump this across the whole project.
replies.author: i509VCB

timeline.bodyText: Maybe mention that one can check if a registration already exists using DefaultAttributeRegistry#hasDefinitionFor(EntityType).
timeline.author: i509VCB
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,60 @@ +/* + * Copyright (c) 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019 FabricMC + * + * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); + * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. + * You may obtain a copy of the License at + * + * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 + * + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software + * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and + * limitations under the License. + */ + +package net.fabricmc.fabric.api.entity.attribute.v1; + +import java.util.function.Supplier; + +import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType; +import net.minecraft.entity.LivingEntity; +import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeContainer; + +import net.fabricmc.fabric.impl.entity.attribute.FabricEntityAttributeRegistry; + +/** + * Allows registering custom default attributes for living entities. + * + *

All living entity types must have default attributes registered.

+ * + *

A registered default attribute for an entity type can be retrieved through + * {@link net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeRegistry#get(EntityType)}.

+ * + * @see net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeRegistry + * @deprecated Vanilla snapshot feature, subject to vanilla change + */ +@Deprecated +public interface EntityAttributeRegistry { + /** + * The entity attribute registry provided by the Fabric API. + */ + EntityAttributeRegistry INSTANCE = FabricEntityAttributeRegistry.INSTANCE; + + /** + * Registers a default attribute for a type of living entity. + * + *

It can be used in a fashion similar to this: + * 

+	 * EntityAttributeRegistry.INSTANCE.register(type, LivingEntity::createLivingAttributes);
+	 *
+ *

+ * + *

If a registration overrides another, a log message will be emitted./p>

timeline.bodyText: I would just mention the Identifier of the entity in the log. Also EntityType does not have a toString method, so the log would show Overriding existing registration for entity type EntityType@2673ab (id "randommobs:giant") or something like that/
timeline.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: Note that Registry.ENTITY_TYPE.getId() may return null
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: In that case maybe mention the entity type had no registration. Anyways people should be registering their entities before assigning attributes to them.
replies.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: Done, seems vanilla assumes entity type always has an id in registry as well (see EntityType#getTranslationKey), so it's safe for us to do the same.
replies.author: liach

timeline.bodyText: Similarly to above mention of logging here.
timeline.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: liach

timeline.bodyText: I like the way BlockRenderLayerMapImpl uses BiConsumer's to handle early and late registrations. Its basicly the same as what you have, migt just be a bit cleaner.
timeline.author: modmuss50

replies.bodyText: It may help cut down the number of times the same log is also printed
replies.author: modmuss50

timeline.bodyText: should this be allowed? is there a reason a mod should do this?
timeline.author: modmuss50

timeline.bodyText: is there a reason behind the supplier?
timeline.author: modmuss50
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,60 @@ +/* + * Copyright (c) 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019 FabricMC + * + * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); + * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. + * You may obtain a copy of the License at + * + * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 + * + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software + * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and + * limitations under the License. + */ + +package net.fabricmc.fabric.api.entity.attribute.v1; + +import java.util.function.Supplier; + +import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType; +import net.minecraft.entity.LivingEntity; +import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeContainer; + +import net.fabricmc.fabric.impl.entity.attribute.FabricEntityAttributeRegistry; + +/** + * Allows registering custom default attributes for living entities. + * + *

All living entity types must have default attributes registered.

+ * + *

A registered default attribute for an entity type can be retrieved through + * {@link net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeRegistry#get(EntityType)}.

+ * + * @see net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeRegistry + * @deprecated Vanilla snapshot feature, subject to vanilla change + */ +@Deprecated +public interface EntityAttributeRegistry { + /** + * The entity attribute registry provided by the Fabric API. + */ + EntityAttributeRegistry INSTANCE = FabricEntityAttributeRegistry.INSTANCE; + + /** + * Registers a default attribute for a type of living entity. + * + *

It can be used in a fashion similar to this: + * 

+	 * EntityAttributeRegistry.INSTANCE.register(type, LivingEntity::createLivingAttributes);
+	 *
+ *

+ * + *

If a registration overrides another, a log message will be emitted./p> + * + * @param type the entity type + * @param builderSupplier the supplier giving a builder that creates the default attribute + */ + void register(EntityType type, Supplier builderSupplier);

replies.bodyText: Just in case the DefaultAttributeRegistry class is not loaded when this attribute registry is called. Or we can make the attribute registry from fabric classload vanilla DefaultAttributeRegistry
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: is there an issue with loading that sooner? or is this a solution looking for an issue?
replies.author: modmuss50

replies.bodyText: no issue, so I decided to simplify this whole thing
replies.author: liach

timeline.message:
Remove unnecessary abstractions and always classload vanilla default attribute registry

Signed-off-by: liach <liach@users.noreply.github.com>

Add missing license header

Signed-off-by: liach <liach@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: This is looking a lot cleaner now. Is there ever a case that this would be ok? if not id just crash.
timeline.author: modmuss50
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,67 @@ +/* + * Copyright (c) 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019 FabricMC + * + * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); + * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. + * You may obtain a copy of the License at + * + * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 + * + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software + * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and + * limitations under the License. + */ + +package net.fabricmc.fabric.api.entity.attribute.v1; + +import org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager; +import org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger; + +import net.minecraft.entity.EntityType; +import net.minecraft.entity.LivingEntity; +import net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeContainer; +import net.minecraft.util.registry.Registry; + +import net.fabricmc.fabric.mixin.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeRegistryAccessor; + +/** + * Allows registering custom default attributes for living entities. + * + *

All living entity types must have default attributes registered.

+ * + *

A registered default attribute for an entity type can be retrieved through + * {@link net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeRegistry#get(EntityType)}.

+ * + * @see net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeRegistry + * @deprecated Vanilla snapshot feature, subject to vanilla change + */ +@Deprecated +public final class FabricDefaultAttributeRegistry { + /** + * Private logger, not exposed. + */ + private static final Logger LOGGER = LogManager.getLogger(); + + /** + * Registers a default attribute for a type of living entity. + * + *

It can be used in a fashion similar to this: + * 

+	 * EntityAttributeRegistry.INSTANCE.register(type, LivingEntity.createLivingAttributes());
+	 *
+ *

+ * + *

If a registration overrides another, a log message will be emitted. Existing registrations + * can be checked at {@link net.minecraft.entity.attribute.DefaultAttributeRegistry#hasDefinitionFor(EntityType)}.

+ * + * @param type the entity type + * @param builder the builder that creates the default attribute + */ + public static void register(EntityType type, DefaultAttributeContainer.Builder builder) { + if (DefaultAttributeRegistryAccessor.getRegistry().put(type, builder.build()) != null) { + LOGGER.info("Overriding existing registration for entity type {}", Registry.ENTITY_TYPE.getId(type));

replies.bodyText:
This should be fine if other mods changes default values from other builders,
e.g. they can do ZombieEntity.createZombieAttributes().add(movementSpeed, 2.0) etc to override default values. I see that some mods may need to override such values.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Should it warn if this happens then? If its inteneded it shouldnt warn about it, if its not it should crash.
replies.author: modmuss50

replies.bodyText: putting it in the debug log might not be a bad idea, I dont think its needed at the info level.
replies.author: modmuss50

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: liach

timeline.bodyText:
Hmm, do we have a consistent message for this type of dummy error across the whole api? I see we seem to have multiple cases of this across the place.
One idea I had was an instance of an exception that we should throw in the fabric-base-api so we only refer to one common message we know.
timeline.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: I dont think it really needs its own exception, having them all the same would be nice, prob out of scope for this PR.
replies.author: modmuss50

replies.bodyText:
One idea I had was an instance of an exception that we should throw in the fabric-base-api so we only refer to one common message we know.

Do you mean that we should expose the standard thrown error in the base api? Cannot agree, this is more impl-oriented and isn't really useful
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: No standard error, I'd throw UnsupportedOperationException("dummy method, impl to be swapped by mixin") or similar.
replies.author: sfPlayer1

replies.bodyText: Yeah guess I forgot to update this
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Done, thanks
replies.author: liach

timeline.message:
Explicitly note that this API is experimental

Signed-off-by: liach <liach@users.noreply.github.com>

Debug only for overriding

Signed-off-by: liach <liach@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: The message doesn't match the standard form, see #499

timeline.message:
Move default attribute registry into object builders

Looks fitting!

Signed-off-by: liach <liach@users.noreply.github.com>
